sentences.text: Hopefully at this point you understand why footwork is so important.
Every other part of your game builds off your movement.
So I found that developing a player's footwork is the quickest way to accelerate their boundaries and skills.
In this module, I'm going to teach you the eight building blocks of footwork are distinct elements that you need to learn.
They're called building blocks because you learn them individually and then put them together like bricks in a building.
These are the foundations that we're going to build your footwork on.
The first two building blocks are the stance and the split step.
These are positional building blocks.
Next we have running steps and chassis steps.
These are movement building blocks.
And finally we have the Lunge Physic, China Jump and Net Jump.
These are finishing building blocks.
We're going to spend an entire lesson on each of these because they're incredibly important.
I'm going to teach you how to build them from the ground up and then give you assignments to practise and make sure you're doing them correctly.
In my experience playing and coaching Bamboost for over ten years, I've noticed that a lot of players have picked up really bad habits that they aren't even aware of.
So for that reason, I want you to forget everything you've learned going through this module and build everything with me from the ground up.

If you think that these building blocks are really basic and you can already do them, then that's even more of a reason to pay attention to this module, since you may be making mistakes that you aren't even aware of.
Even though I know there's a temptation to jump right into the fun stuff, mastering the eight building blocks is essential.
If you are building a house, you need to first spend some time making sure that all the bricks were up to standard.
If you didn't and build a house with crumbly bricks, the whole building would just collapse.
So sure, if you jump right into footwork, you might get a small head start.
But eventually that's going to catch up with you down the line and you'll have to start from square one.
Imagine a complex gymnastics routine, the one with the tight leotards, breathtaking backflips and death defying formations.
Now imagine if you wanted to try out gymnastics and went to your local club for the first time.
I certainly would walk straight back out the door if the coach told me I had to try this on my first session.
And that makes sense.
Every single gymnast in this video started off learning simple techniques like planks, push ups and pull ups.
So why should Bambin be any different?
You can't jump into the more advanced stuff until you master the basics.
If you're serious about improving Abomination, I want you to pay attention to this module.
This could be the most important thing you learn.
In the next module, you'll be learning how to combine these to start travelling effectively to all corners of the badminton court.
But you can't do that until you've mastered the basics.
So I'll see you in the next video where we'll go over the first building block of footwork that starts.
